result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: and environmental issues.In this paper, the prepared Fe-TiO 2 octahedrons were applied for the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 with water.The photoreduction experiments were performed in a gas solid system containing water and CO 2 under visible-light ( 420 nm).Fig. 8a displays that the Fe-TiO 2 octahedrons 8c.The strongest peak of both samples appears at g 1.99, which can be attributed to Fe 3 substituted for Ti 4 in the TiO 2 lattice 48.This result confirms that Fe 3 ions are successfully doped into the

can provide more active sites for the subsequent photocatalytic reaction and enhance its photocatalytic property.A high magnification SEM image of a single Fe-TiO 2 octahedron (the inset of Fig. 2c) reveals that each octahedron was composed of nanoparticles, which provides TiO 2 photocatalyst with a large specific surface area.After annealing at 500 C in air, there was no apparent change in the morphology and the size of octahedra (Fig. 2d), indicating the high stability of Fe-TiO 2 . Further

Fe-TiO 2 and Fe-TiO 2 -500 were about 2.75 eV and 2.42 eV, respectively.Fe-TiO 2 -500 shows excellent photocatalytic activity due to its special structure, high BET surface area and porosity.The yield of CH 4 is about 7.73 mol g -1 after loading of Pt within 12 h of reaction time under visible light illumination ( 420 nm).

absolute ethanol repeatedly, then dried under vacuum at 60 C for 24 h.The obtained powder was named as Fe-TiO 2 .In order to remove residual MIL-101 and organic solvents before the CO 2 reduction cycle starts, Fe-TiO 2 was calcined at 500 C in air atmosphere for 6 h, the resultant product was named as Fe-TiO 2 -500.The synthesis of pure TiO nanoparticles is very similar to that of Fe-TiO 2 , except the remove of MIL-101(Fe) (5.0 mg).

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']

7 shows UV-Vis spectral of all samples.The absorption threshold of the MIL-101(Fe) is located at about 600 nm.The Fe-TiO 2 octahedra have a great enhancement in the light absorption at wavelengths of 400-600 nm compared to that of the pure anatase TiO 2 .Heat treatment leads to a red shift of the absorption edge.The optical band gap energy of the pure TiO 2 , MIL-101(Fe), Fe-TiO 2 and Fe-TiO 2 -500 are about 3.3 eV, 2.80 eV, 2.75 eV and 2.42 eV calculated from the intercept of the tangents to the plots

eV, which are the satellite structure of Fe 3 41.The O 1s XPS spectra can be deconvoluted into two main peaks (Fig. 6d).The peak centered at 529.8 eV could be attributed to the lattice oxygen for TiO 2 42.Another O 1s peak at 531.4 eV belongs likely to the chemisorbed oxygen (i.e., OH, H 2 O) in the surface groups 43.The atom Fe, Ti and O contents of on the surface of octahedra were calculated to be 7.0, 30.9 and 62.1 wt , respectively, which is very similar to the EDS results.Fig. 7 shows UV-Vis spectral

mg) was dissolved in ethanol (10 mL), followed by adding tetrabutyl titanate (50 L) into the solution.The mixture was dispersed homogeneously by magnetic stirring for 20 min.Subsequently, 700 L of deionized water and 20 L of HF were mixed with constantly stirring for 10 min.Finally, it was transferred into a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave and heated for 20 h at 180 C. inset of Fig. 3c.The elemental mapping by energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS) indicates the uniform distribution of Ti, O and Fe species in the Fe-TiO sample (Fig. 3d-g).The contents of Fe, Ti and O are determined to be 6.8, 32.0 and 61.2 wt, respectively.The atomic ratio of Ti and O elements is found to be 1.9, which is close to the theoretical atomic ratio of TiO 2 .The Fe element comes from MIL-101(Fe) precursor.An interesting observation is that there are no TiO 2 deposition in solution when

MIL-101(Fe) octahedra were prepared by a solvothermal method.Then, MIL-101(Fe) octahedra were treated with HF and tetrabutyl titanate to form Fe-TiO 2 .In order to remove the residual MIL-101(Fe), Fe-TiO 2 was calcined in air at 500 C for 6 h, and got the Fe-TiO 2 -500 sample.The hydrothermal reaction of tetrabutyl titanate and HF aqueous solution without MIL-101 resulted in pure TiO particles (Fig.S1and Fig.1).Fig. 1 displays the XRD patterns of MIL-101(Fe), TiO 2 , Fe-TiO 2 and Fe-TiO 2 -500.It can be
